description: Gwinnett County police suspended the search Saturday night for a 14-year-old teenager who may have been swept downstream while playing with friends in the Yellow River.
title: Missing Gwinnett teen possibly swept downstream on...
title_page: Cops: Missing Gwinnett teen possibly swept downstream on...
text:
Gwinnett County police suspended the search Saturday night for a 14-year-old teenager who may have been swept downstream while playing with friends in the Yellow River.
Officers will resume searching on Sunday morning for Jaheem McGhee, a black male about 5-foot-5 and 120 pounds. He was last seen around Thursday.
Friends of the missing teen told police that McGhee and three others decided to cross the Yellow River that day. Three of them made it over to the other bank. However, the friends said McGhee didn’t.
Gwinnett Police spokeswoman Cpl. Michele Pihera said that authorities were not notified about the disappearance until late Friday night or early Saturday morning.
“We have officers searching the Yellow River on foot,” Pihera said in an email. “Our helicopter was assisting with the search, too.”
Police also requested assistance from a cadaver search dog, which is standard protocol, Pihera said.
